answers.answer: Hi,Stiff-person syndrome (SPS) is a rare neurological disorder with features of  autoimmune diseases such as  such as diabetes, thyroiditis, vitiligo, and pernicious anemia.  For definitive diagnosis, a blood test that measures the level of glutamic acid decarboxylase (GAD) antibodies in the blood, an antibody that works against an enzyme involved in the synthesis of an important neurotransmitter in the brain. Discuss this test with your attending physician for proper evaluation. Treatment with IVIg, anti-anxiety drugs, muscle relaxants, anti-convulsants, and pain relievers will improve and control the symptoms of SPS. Take care and do keep us posted.
